Package com.hissain.jscipy.signal.fft

Class FFT

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hissain.jscipy.signal.fft.FFT
  • public class FFT
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for performing Fast Fourier Transforms (FFT) and Short-Time Fourier Transforms (STFT). This class uses the Apache Commons Math library for FFT calculations.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      FFT()
      Constructs a new FFT object.

        Returns:
        The 2D complex spatial domain signal.

      • rfft

        public JComplex[] rfft​(double[] input)
        Computes the forward FFT of a real-valued signal and returns the positive frequency components.
        Parameters:
        input - The input signal.
        Returns:
        The positive frequency components of the FFT as an array of JComplex objects.

      • irfft

        public double[] irfft​(JComplex[] input,
                      int n)
        Computes the inverse FFT of a real-valued signal.
        Parameters:
        input - The complex-valued input signal.
        n - The length of the original signal.
        Returns:
        The real-valued inverse FFT of the signal.

      • stft

        public JComplex[][] stft​(double[] x)
        Computes the Short-Time Fourier Transform (STFT) with default parameters. Uses nperseg=256, noverlap=128, Hann window, and zero-padding.
        Parameters:
        x - The input signal.
        Returns:
        A 2D array of complex values [frequency bins][time frames] representing the STFT.

      • istft

        public double[] istft​(JComplex[][] stftMatrix)
        Computes the Inverse Short-Time Fourier Transform (ISTFT) with default parameters. Uses nperseg=256, noverlap=128, Hann window, and assumes zero-padding was used.
        Parameters:
        stftMatrix - The STFT matrix [frequency bins][time frames].
        Returns:
        The reconstructed time-domain signal.

      • stft

        public JComplex[][] stft​(double[] x,
                         java.lang.Integer nperseg,
                         java.lang.Integer noverlap,
                         java.lang.Integer nfft,
                         double[] window,
                         java.lang.String boundary,
                         java.lang.Boolean padded)
        Computes the Short-Time Fourier Transform (STFT) of a signal. This implementation matches the behavior of scipy.signal.stft with default parameters.
        Parameters:
        x - The input signal.
        nperseg - The length of each segment (window size). Default is 256.
        noverlap - The number of points to overlap between segments. Default is nperseg // 2.
        nfft - The FFT size to use. If null, uses nperseg. Must be >= nperseg.
        window - The window function to apply. If null, uses Hann window.
        boundary - The boundary extension mode. "zeros" pads with zeros, null means no padding.
        padded - Whether to pad the signal on both sides. Default is true.
        Returns:
        A 2D array of complex values [frequency bins][time frames] representing the STFT.

      • istft

        public double[] istft​(JComplex[][] stftMatrix,
                      java.lang.Integer nperseg,
                      java.lang.Integer noverlap,
                      java.lang.Integer nfft,
                      double[] window,
                      java.lang.String boundary,
                      java.lang.Integer inputLength)
        Computes the Inverse Short-Time Fourier Transform (ISTFT). This implementation matches the behavior of scipy.signal.istft with default parameters.
        Parameters:
        stftMatrix - The STFT matrix [frequency bins][time frames].
        nperseg - The length of each segment (window size). Must match the STFT parameters.
        noverlap - The number of points to overlap between segments. Must match the STFT parameters.
        nfft - The FFT size used. If null, inferred from stftMatrix dimensions.
        window - The window function used in STFT. If null, uses Hann window.
        boundary - The boundary extension mode used in STFT. "zeros" means padding was used.
        inputLength - The expected output length. If null, inferred from stftMatrix.
        Returns:
        The reconstructed time-domain signal.
